key_sentences: Take that, and give it to them for me and you.”
I said to you, “I am Yahweh your God.
So it was done to them.
Is there a God besides me?
There is no god with me.

[0 1]: Blessed are those who keep his statutes, who seek him with their whole heart.
You have commanded your precepts, that we should fully obey them.
Oh that my ways were steadfast to obey your statutes!
[0 2]: Let them be consigned to the king’s chamberlain, the keeper of the women.
Let the woman who pleases the king be queen instead of Vashti.” This thing pleased the king; and he did so.
And the matter was discovered by Mordecai, and he made it known to Esther, and she declared to the king the matter of the conspiracy.
[0 3]: You shall eat, and not be satisfied.
Therefore the peoples shall give you thanks forever and ever.
If you° be born, you° shall be born to a curse; If you° die, a curse shall be your portion.
[0 4]: Why then will you sin against innocent blood, to kill David without a cause?” Saul listened to the voice of Jonathan; and Saul swore, “As Yahweh lives, he shall not be put to death.” Jonathan called David, and Jonathan showed him all those things.
Then Jonathan brought David to Saul, and he was in his presence as before.
An evil spirit from Yahweh was on Saul as he sat in his house with his spear in his hand; and David was playing music with his hand.
[0 5]: Blessed are those whose ways are blameless, who walk according to Yahweh’s law.
Open my eyes, that I may see wondrous things out of your law.
